oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Third-order optical nonlinearity of chlorin derivatives
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, BP
VIJAYA, R
KUNDU, T
KANDASAMY, K
PUNTAMBEKAR, PN
SHETTY, SJ
SRIVASTAVA, TS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: porphyrins
polarizability
systems
chlorins
tetraphenylchlorin
third-order optical nonlinearity
second-order molecular hyperpolarizability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Second-order molecular hyperpolarizabilities (gamma) of four tetraphenylchlorin derivatives were measured by the Z-scan technique at 784 nm in the off-resonant region and the enhancement in the hyperpolarizabilities of these derivatives in comparison to the regular porphyrins with the same external side-groups is explained on the basis of the difference in their Q-band oscillator strengths.
